title: Two shot in San Francisco on New Year’s Eve
text:
SAN FRANCISCO – Two people were shot in San Francisco on New Year’s Eve, police said.

Officers were called to the area of Franklin and Bay streets — near Fort Mason and only a few blocks from Ghirardelli Square — around 9:35 p.m. for a report of a shooting. They arrived to find two men with apparent gunshot wounds.

The victims were rushed to a hospital, one with life-threatening injuries and the other with non-life-threatening injuries, police said.

Police said the suspect is still at large as of Wednesday morning.

Additional information about the shooting, including a motive, was not immediately available.

DEVELOPING: Two men have been found with gunshot wounds near Lombard St & Franklin St after an apparent drive-by shooting. pic.twitter.com/FJlD21ew8z — Citizen San Francisco Bay Area (@CitizenAppSFO) January 1, 2020

Check back for updates.
authors: Jason Green Is A Breaking News Reporter For The Bay Area News Group. He Works Week Nights
Spends Most Of His Time Covering Crime
Public Safety. A Graduate Of Uc Santa Barbara
He Cut His Teeth At The Inland Valley Daily Bulletin
Has Been With The Bay Area News Group Since Its Inception.
Casey Tolan Covers Politics For The Bay Area News Group.

og.title: Two shot in San Francisco on New Year’s Eve
og.description: One victim was left with life-threatening injuries; suspect is still at large
